this is an actual page out of the Gospel
of Thomas so we know that ancient gospel
actually existed the Gospel of Thomas is
a non-canonical collection of 114
sayings attributed to Jesus it's known
as an apocryphal text which means it's a
work that comes with some Authority but
was not included in the new New
Testament the sayings are structured as
direct quotes of Jesus somewhat similar
to the biblical Book of Proverbs unlike
the canonical gospels of Matthew Mark
Luke and John the Gospel of Thomas does
not contain Narrative of Jesus's life
his death or his resurrection instead it
focuses on his teachings many of which
are presented as esoteric or secret
wisdom the Gospel of Thomas was
discovered near nag hamadi Egypt in
December 1945 among with a group of
books known as the nag hamadi Library
these texts were hidden in a j and
buried in the ground at the base of a
cliff known as jabal Al tarf Scholars
suspect that they were buried for
safekeeping by monks from the nearby
Monastery of St pomus when the
possession of such texts became
politically dangerous due to the
emerging Orthodox Christian doctrine the
original manuscripts are written in
Coptic but the text is believed to have
been translated from an earli Greek
version the dating of the Gospel of
Thomas is a matter of scholarly debate
but the consensus is that the Coptic
version found at nag hamadi dates back
to approximately the 4th Century ad
however some of the sayings within it
could be much older with Scholars and
historians estimating that the original
Greek texts were likely composed
sometime in the 2 Century ad the this
would make the savings of Jesus as
recorded in the Gospel of Thomas some of
the earliest Christian writings roughly
contemporary with the canonical gospels
